CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1964, pg. 2 reads: "Preparation - Bob McNally, chief X-ray technician from Kane Hospital and chairman of the Health-O-Rama Committee for the Western Pennsylvania [sic] Society of X-Ray Technicians, District 1, checks final plans with local X-ray technicians. These volunteers from cooperating hospitals, Magee and Mercy, take full responsibility for staffing the X-ray equipment which will be used at the next Health-O-Rama, scheduled for the Savoy Ballroom, 2009 Centre Ave., April 9,10,11 and 12.  To date, volunteer X-ray technicians from all over the county have taken more than 90,000 X-rays at the 16 previous Health-O-Ramas and played a major part in success of the program.  Other technicians in the program are (from left to right) Doris Lewis, Donna Bodenhorn, Donna Marrocco, Bob McNally, Pat Kelly and Monica Jasenak."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of X-ray technicians Doris Lewis, Donna Bodenhorn, Donna Marrocco, Bob McNally, Pat Kelly, and Monica Jasenak, observing x-ray in hospital, possibly Kane
